notes.text:
Multiple vulnerabilities affect the RUGGEDCOM Operating System (ROS). 

Siemens has released new versions for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens is preparing further fix versions and recommends countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: The use of Siemens Security Advisories is subject to the terms and conditions listed on: https://www.siemens.com/productcert/terms-of-use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

references.summary: SSA-083019: Multiple Vulnerabilities in RUGGEDCOM ROS Devices - HTML Version
SSA-083019: Multiple Vulnerabilities in RUGGEDCOM ROS Devices - CSAF Version

document.title: SSA-083019: Multiple Vulnerabilities in RUGGEDCOM ROS Devices

cwe.name: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

notes.text: The affected products support insecure cryptographic algorithms. An attacker could leverage these legacy algorithms to achieve a man-in-the-middle attack or impersonate communicating parties.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Restrict access to port 80/tcp, 443/tcp and 22/tcp to trusted IP addresses only
Deactivate the webserver if not required, and if deactivation is supported by the product
Deactivate the SSH server if not required, and if deactivation is supported by the product
Update to V5.10.0 or later version

threats.details: The affected features are not supported.

notes.text: Affected devices do not properly handle malformed TLS handshake messages. This could allow an attacker with network access to the webserver to cause a denial of service resulting in the web server and the device to crash.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Restrict access to port 80/tcp, 443/tcp and 22/TCP, to trusted IP addresses only
Deactivate the webserver if not required, and if deactivation is supported by the product
Deactivate the SSH server if not required, and if deactivation is supported by the product
Update to V5.10.0 or later version

threats.details: The affected features are not supported.

cwe.name: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

notes.text: The affected devices support the TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 cipher suite, which uses CBC (Cipher Block Chaining) mode that is known to be vulnerable to timing attacks. This could allow an attacker to compromise the integrity and confidentiality of encrypted communications.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Configure the web client to use GCM ciphers; for list of ROS supported cipher suites refer to configuration manual
Update to V5.10.0 or later version

threats.details: The affected features are not supported.

notes.text: The affected products do not properly enforce interface access restrictions when changing from management to non-management interface configurations until a system reboot occurs, despite configuration being saved. This could allow an attacker with network access and credentials to gain access to device through non-management and maintain SSH access to the device until reboot.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V5.10.0 or later version
Update to V5.10.0 or later version

threats.details: The affected functionality is implemented in a different way and not vulnerable.
